reviews.text: First, let me say that tripadvisor.com did not recognize the name of this hotel when I typed La Rosetta. This hotel is incorrectly listed as La Rossetta. There is only one "s" in the name.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Gracious Staff
Beautiful Hotel - Perfect Location - Rude Staff
reviews.text: Now that I got that out of the way, let me comment about the hotel. It is well-located on Piazza Italia at one end of the Corso Vannucci. The piazza is a hub of cars, taxi cabs, vespas and buses. There is a ticket book located right in the piazza, so you can buy your bus tickets there. We never heard any outside noise in our hotel room.

The hotel is lovely and has a private outer courtyard. Since we arrived on April 30th, it was too cool for guests to spend a lot of time out there - but there was always someone at the outside tables.
reviews.title: Old World Charm Right on the Square

likes.disliked: — long walk to room - might be tough for someone with a disability

reviews.text: Our room was clean and spacious with two twin beds pushed together. The room had two closets, which worked out well for us. The continental breakfast included in the room rate was the standard fare.
reviews.title: Would not reccommend this hotel

reviews.text: We had planned to stay five nights, but a train strike was scheduled and we had to leave La Rosetta early. The staff was understanding about our situation and there was no penalty for leaving early. Outstanding people!
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel

reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel La Rosetta in mid September. The rooms are clean and spacious, compared to European standards; the staff is very helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location. Wonderful Staff. Highly recommended!

likes.disliked: — Truffles are typical of this region....make sure to order a dish at the restaurant that contans this local specialty.

reviews.text: We also recommend their restaurant.....we had delicious dinners and lessons on "abbinamento" (how to complement a meal with the perfect wine).
reviews.title: Perugia Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perugia is an excellent base to visit the Umbria region.
reviews.title: Disappointing!

reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, helpful staff, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rated this hotel as average compared to the other hotels we stayed in. We had trouble with the air conditioning unit and after several tries at fixing it, we were moved to another room. The rooms could use some updating but they are clean. The beds were uncomfortable and the breakfast was just okay. We had friends who joined us and their room was palatial by comparison so I guess your stay would depend on what room you get.
reviews.title: Nice surprise
An Excellent Hotel in a Quaint Town
reviews.text: Our son is studying in Perugia and stayed in this hotel his first night before being assigned to an apartment, so he recommended we stay here since he had first hand knowledge.

We traveled to three cities in Italy during our trip and this was the best experience we had. The breakfast was continental style, but very good. We ate dinner here and were somewhat disappointed in the selection. The service was abrupt and the waiter was unwilling to help us discipher the menu which was all in Italian.
reviews.title: Great location at Piazza Italia
Great base in Perugia for exploring Umbria
reviews.text: That being said, the room was terrific and large, the bathroom luxurious and the service very attentive. The front desk staff was very accomodating and helpful.
